content.raw: Hi @almin , this is looking great! There are a few small details to be polished here and there, but I think we can address those as we make small pull requests to default. I'll merge this now :wink: Let me know if you'd like to be part of porting this to default after pull request #2420 is merged. Cheers!
content.html: Hi @almin , this is looking great! There are a few small details to be polished here and there, but I think we can address those as we make small pull requests to default. I'll merge this now Let me know if you'd like to be part of porting this to default after pull request #2420 is merged. Cheers!

content.raw:
The problem is this:

auto sensor = this->GetSensor(parts[i+1]);

We fetch a sensor named "camera". 

For model camera0 it is "camera" and for model camera it is also "camera". So 2 live sensors with the same name exist in this world. 
Now in the second case (click sensor from model "camera0"), the first sensor with GetSensor is fetched again (because of the same name "camera"), thus comparing URI from model "camera0" with model "camera".

Do you have an idea on how to catch the second sensor in this case? 
We could maybe iterate over all live sensors somehow until it matches one of them. If not, then return and gzerror.
content.html:
The problem is this:

auto sensor = this->GetSensor(parts[i+1]);

We fetch a sensor named "camera".

For model camera0 it is "camera" and for model camera it is also "camera". So 2 live sensors with the same name exist in this world. Now in the second case (click sensor from model "camera0"), the first sensor with GetSensor is fetched again (because of the same name "camera"), thus comparing URI from model "camera0" with model "camera".

Do you have an idea on how to catch the second sensor in this case? We could maybe iterate over all live sensors somehow until it matches one of them. If not, then return and gzerror.

update.description:
* add ignition transoprt service for world plugins. Error with including ignmsgsdf to model and world.

* gui, world, model, sensor and visual plugins work with ignition transport now.

* visual rendering scene error with ignition::msgs not declared

* sensormanager and scene visuals problem. emailed to louise Poubel.

* GUI list + plugins work again

* can not find visual

* can not find visual

* make visual plugins work. Testing.

* visual and plugin properties work. cleaned world and gui code

* revised everything. clean code for world, gui and visual ign plugins Louise will verify
update.title: Plugins_ign_almin

content.raw: I will have to take a look.
content.html: I will have to take a look.

content.raw:
There seems to be a problem if there is more than one sensor:

1. On an empty world, insert a camera, it is called `camera`

1. Then insert another camera, it's called `camera_0`

1. Click on the camera sensor for `camera`, the info shows, but some warnings are printed:

        [Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] world[Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] model[Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] link[Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] sensor

1. Click on the camera sensor for `camera_0`, the info doesn't show and we get an error:

        [Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] world[Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] model[Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] link[Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] sensor[Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:939] Sensor [data://world/default/model/camera_0/link/link/sensor/camera] does not match sensor [data://default::camera::link::camera]
        [Err] [ModelListWidget.cc:3915] Failed to receive sensor info. Check server logs.
content.html:
There seems to be a problem if there is more than one sensor:

  1. On an empty world, insert a camera, it is called camera

  2. Then insert another camera, it's called camera_0

  3. Click on the camera sensor for camera, the info shows, but some warnings are printed:

    [Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] world[Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] model[Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] link[Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] sensor

  4. Click on the camera sensor for camera_0, the info doesn't show and we get an error:

    [Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] world[Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] model[Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] link[Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:909] sensor[Wrn] [SensorManager.cc:939] Sensor [data://world/default/model/camera_0/link/link/sensor/camera] does not match sensor [data://default::camera::link::camera]
[Err] [ModelListWidget.cc:3915] Failed to receive sensor info. Check server logs.

content.raw: We're changing the gazebo code style and removing all `Get`s. Do you mind removing it and leaving it as `Sensor::SDF`?
content.html: We're changing the gazebo code style and removing all Gets. Do you mind removing it and leaving it as Sensor::SDF?

content.raw: I [queued](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/) a Jenkins job to get the style / tests left. I'm taking a look at everything now.
content.html: I queued a Jenkins job to get the style / tests left. I'm taking a look at everything now.

content.raw: I added the promised one click functionality to sensors and visuals. Also removed all prints. Could you just post me sh style output? Even with grep I get 2200 messages. You can also send me a mail. And could you look over lines 2848 to 2859 and 2882 to 2895 in ModelListWidget.cc? I am not sure if we can handle the uncommented functionality now. I think _msg.pose() does not work.
content.html: I added the promised one click functionality to sensors and visuals. Also removed all prints. Could you just post me sh style output? Even with grep I get 2200 messages. You can also send me a mail. And could you look over lines 2848 to 2859 and 2882 to 2895 in ModelListWidget.cc? I am not sure if we can handle the uncommented functionality now. I think _msg.pose() does not work.

content.raw:
You need the latest default branch from ign-msgs:

    cd <path to>/ign-msgs
    hg pull https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs
    hg up default
    cd build
    cmake ..
    make install
content.html:
You need the latest default branch from ign-msgs:

cd <path to>/ign-msgs
hg pull https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs
hg up default
cd build
cmake ..
make install

/home/almin/sen/gsoc_gazebo/gazebo/util/IgnMsgSdf.cc:139:32: error: ‘const class ignition::msgs::Visual’ has no member named ‘plugin_size’ for (int i = 0; i < _msg.plugin_size(); ++i)

I pulled and also tried to pull from ign_serices. No changes found. Do you know the cause of this?

content.raw:
Wow you are fast great work!

I noticed a Problem with the world test, I am fixing that. I will add the failures test.
content.html:
Wow you are fast great work!

I noticed a Problem with the world test, I am fixing that. I will add the failures test.

content.raw:
Take a look at 72d12e6, I refactored visual infos a bit so now we can also return information on all visuals or all plugins.

The test was never getting the visuals because apparently you need a camera in the test. I copied a snippet from one of the tests above and now the tests work.

I didn't add tests for failure cases, but I think it would be a good idea to. It would be good to check if we are forgetting any corner cases.
content.html:
Take a look at 72d12e6, I refactored visual infos a bit so now we can also return information on all visuals or all plugins.

The test was never getting the visuals because apparently you need a camera in the test. I copied a snippet from one of the tests above and now the tests work.

I didn't add tests for failure cases, but I think it would be a good idea to. It would be good to check if we are forgetting any corner cases.

content.raw:
1. Sorry, I have no good ideas for this. The code for QtVariantProperty is [here](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/27bd6c04e5d9eded44a739d46f8bbef7279ca4a1/gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/qtvariantproperty.h?fileviewer=file-view-default) if you want to take a look.

1. I'm a bit lost, which for loops are you talking about?

1. Ok, I'll work on it.
content.html:
1. Sorry, I have no good ideas for this. The code for QtVariantProperty is here if you want to take a look.

  2. I'm a bit lost, which for loops are you talking about?

  3. Ok, I'll work on it.

content.raw:
1. I tried setFlags and Qt textInteractionFlags to disable editing but enable clicking the item and thus displaying the whole text. 
Unfortunately it does not work with Gazebo QtVariantProperty. Do you have an idea for a function like this we could apply to a property?
Otherwise we can maybe somehow draw the cursor inside and display text by that. But I am not sure.

2. Maybe I can add the for loops for the moment so we enable the functionality at least.

3. Could you add the check for VT_VISUALS? And perhaps check the rest of the tests? They should work.
content.html:
1. I tried setFlags and Qt textInteractionFlags to disable editing but enable clicking the item and thus displaying the whole text. Unfortunately it does not work with Gazebo QtVariantProperty. Do you have an idea for a function like this we could apply to a property? Otherwise we can maybe somehow draw the cursor inside and display text by that. But I am not sure.

  2. Maybe I can add the for loops for the moment so we enable the functionality at least.

  3. Could you add the check for VT_VISUALS? And perhaps check the rest of the tests? They should work.

content.raw: Oh! And you might need to build the latest default branch of `ign-msgs`.
content.html: Oh! And you might need to build the latest default branch of ign-msgs.

content.html: Merged and committed into your branch: c569316. Now the visual names show up.

content.raw:
It looks like your fork doesn't have the latest version of `IgnMsgSdf`, that's why the conversions are failing. I'm merging it locally and will commit directly to your branch soon, if that's ok. What I'm doing is:

    # Pull the latest changes of info_services from OSRF's repo:
    hg pull http://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo -b info_services

    # Merge it into your branch:
    hg merge info_services

content.raw:
world tests and the link header should work now.

Things I noticed:

* Not all properties are shown properly (visuals name) with the new visual/sensor SDF function.
These are warnings the compiler returned, seems interesting:
[Err] [IgnMsgSdf.hh:39] Invalid convertion of SDF to type[N8ignition4msgs6VisualE]
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:107] QSpiAccessible::accessibleEvent not handled:  "8008"  obj:  QObject(0x0)  " invalid interface!" 
[Err] [IgnMsgSdf.hh:39] Invalid convertion of SDF to type[N8ignition4msgs6VisualE]
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:107] QSpiAccessible::accessibleEvent not handled:  "8008"  obj:  QObject(0x0)  " invalid interface!" 
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:107] QSpiAccessible::accessibleEvent not handled:  "8008"  obj:  QObject(0x0)  " invalid interface!" 

If you want to fix that.

* If you want to keep the standard URI with visuals (not like this: data://visual/box_sim::link::visual) I can transform the URI into the standard URI by splitting this one at character '::'. 
However, in the VisualInfo, to get the right visual with GetVisual(scopedname of visual); I would have to split the standard URI up again and form the initial URI with the character '::' to be able to search for the visual. I do not know if this extra work is necessary. In my opinion it is fine to keep a specialized version of the PluginInfo approach. Usually you would have one common PluginInfo function and ,if needed, create specialized versions. I think this approach should be fine.

* Currently, as we can not change the plugin properties info, we can not click onto the property to display the whole string. Usually the plugin property is longer than the placeholder space.

![blink.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1227949957-blink.png)

Do you have an idea for that?

* Usually we can open a drag and drop menu in the world tab of e.g. a model with one click. Now for sensors and visuals this is not possible. I would have to search the whole tree with several for-loops to find the clicked visual/sensor. Is this desirable or do you have a better/simpler idea to implement this?
content.html:
world tests and the link header should work now.

Things I noticed:

  • Not all properties are shown properly (visuals name) with the new visual/sensor SDF function. These are warnings the compiler returned, seems interesting: [Err] [IgnMsgSdf.hh:39] Invalid convertion of SDF to type[N8ignition4msgs6VisualE] [Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:107] QSpiAccessible::accessibleEvent not handled: "8008" obj: QObject(0x0) " invalid interface!" [Err] [IgnMsgSdf.hh:39] Invalid convertion of SDF to type[N8ignition4msgs6VisualE] [Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:107] QSpiAccessible::accessibleEvent not handled: "8008" obj: QObject(0x0) " invalid interface!" [Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:107] QSpiAccessible::accessibleEvent not handled: "8008" obj: QObject(0x0) " invalid interface!"

If you want to fix that.

  • If you want to keep the standard URI with visuals (not like this: data://visual/box_sim::visual) I can transform the URI into the standard URI by splitting this one at character '::'. However, in the VisualInfo, to get the right visual with GetVisual(scopedname of visual); I would have to split the standard URI up again and form the initial URI with the character '::' to be able to search for the visual. I do not know if this extra work is necessary. In my opinion it is fine to keep a specialized version of the PluginInfo approach. Usually you would have one common PluginInfo function and ,if needed, create specialized versions. I think this approach should be fine.

  • Currently, as we can not change the plugin properties info, we can not click onto the property to display the whole string. Usually the plugin property is longer than the placeholder space.

Do you have an idea for that?

  • Usually we can open a drag and drop menu in the world tab of e.g. a model with one click. Now for sensors and visuals this is not possible. I would have to search the whole tree with several for-loops to find the clicked visual/sensor. Is this desirable or do you have a better/simpler idea to implement this?

content.raw:
Load another world: is it possible to load another world in the same test case?

Loading this: 
this->Load("worlds/wind_demo.world", true); 
after loading timer_gui is not possible.

Do I need a new function for this test case or can I handle it in the PluginInfoFailures?

Other tests work.
content.html:
Load another world: is it possible to load another world in the same test case?

Loading this: this->Load("worlds/wind_demo.world", true); after loading timer_gui is not possible.

Do I need a new function for this test case or can I handle it in the PluginInfoFailures?

Other tests work.

I just copied your name from model TEST. There it is the same.

TEST_F(ModelTest, PluginInfoFailures) { this->Load("worlds/shapes.world", true);

auto world = physics::get_world("default"); ASSERT_TRUE(world != nullptr);

auto model = world->GetModel("box"); ASSERT_TRUE(model != nullptr);

ignition::msgs::Plugin_V plugins; bool success; common::URI pluginUri;

gzmsg << "Model has no plugins" << std::endl; { pluginUri.Parse("data://world/default/model/box/plugin/"); model->PluginInfo(pluginUri, plugins, success);

EXPECT_TRUE(success);
EXPECT_EQ(plugins.plugins_size(), 0);

}

So what do you think?
